pgrid.network.protocol
Class MessageHeader

java.lang.Object
  org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
      pgrid.util.LexicalDefaultHandler
          pgrid.network.protocol.MessageHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, ContentHandler, DTDHandler, EntityResolver, ErrorHandler, LexicalHandler, Message, PGridMessage, XMLizable
public class MessageHeader
extends LexicalDefaultHandler
implements PGridMessage, XMLizable

This class represents a PGrid header

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
@author Roman Schmidt

Nested Class Summary
static class MessageHeader.DelegateStatus
          Different delegation status:
- toBeDelegated: this message has to be routed by an other peer and then sent back to this one.

startElement

public void startElement(String uri,
                         String lName,
                         String qName,
                         Attributes attrs)
                  throws SAXException
The Parser will invoke this method at the beginning of every element in the XML document; there will be a corresponding endElement event for every startElement event (even when the element is empty). All of the element's content will be reported, in order, before the corresponding endElement event.

Specified by:
startElement in interface ContentHandler
Specified by:
startElement in interface XMLizable
Overrides:
startElement in class DefaultHandler
Parameters:
uri - the Namespace URI.
lName - the local name (without prefix), or the empty string if Namespace processing is not being performed.
qName - the qualified name (with prefix), or the empty string if qualified names are not available.
attrs - the attributes attached to the element. If there are no attributes, it shall be an empty Attributes object.
Throws:
SAXException - any SAX exception, possibly wrapping another exception.

                       String lName,
                       String qName)
                throws SAXException

The SAX parser will invoke this method at the end of every element in the XML document; there will be a corresponding startElement event for every endElement event (even when the element is empty).

Specified by:

qName - the qualified name (with prefix), or the empty string if qualified names are not available.

setAdditionalAttribute

public void setAdditionalAttribute(String key,
                                   String value)
Set an application specific attribute. The key and value will be written in the XML representation of this header therefor they should be XML complient.

Parameters:
key - the key
value - the value

getParser

public XMLReader getParser()
get the XML parser for this message. This method is used internally, do not use it.

setClientAddress

public void setClientAddress(PGridHost host)
set the client address to the given one. If a client address is provided, it means that this message has been re-issued by a super peer and the "host" address will be used to forward reply message back to the real initiator.

Parameters:
host - host client address.

getClientAddress

public PGridHost getClientAddress()
get the client address for this message. If a client address is provided, it means that this message has been re-issued by a super peer and the "host" address will be used to forward reply message back to the real initiator.
